question: In the following scheme of reaction,
images/a1b2c3d4-e5f6-4789-8012-34567890abcd.png
X, Y and Z respectively are:
choices: HF, aqueous KOH and Na in dry ether
<katex>$Hg_{2}F_{2}$</katex>, alcoholic KOH and Na in dry ether
explanation: 1. Conversion of <katex>$C_2H_5Cl$</katex> to <katex>$C_2H_5F$</katex> is the Swarts reaction, using metallic fluorides like <katex>$AgF$</katex>, <katex>$Hg_2F_2$</katex>, etc. 2. Dehydrohalogenation of <katex>$C_2H_5Cl$</katex> to ethene requires alcoholic KOH. 3. Wurtz reaction converts <katex>$C_2H_5Cl$</katex> to butane using Na in dry ether. Option C provides a valid set of reagents.
